image.altText: Drone shot of water and port surrounding a steelwork factory

props.synopsis: Following the first creditors' meeting, administrators of Whyalla Ports have revealed the company owes at least $194 million to various creditors.

title.children: Administrators reveal staggering debts of Whyalla Ports

image.altText: Matthew Draganoff in front of a Union Jack flag

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court jury has found 48-year-old Matthew Draganoff guilty of the shooting murder of Simon Middleton at a property on the northern outskirts of Adelaide in 2021.

title.children: SA landlord found guilty of murdering tenant in 2021 shooting

image.altText: Tomatoes on display at a store.

props.synopsis: A virus outbreak in southern states and wet weather in northern growing areas cause a tomato shortage and an increase in prices when they are available.

title.children: What's behind the tomato shortage?

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair wearing a black tshirt sits in a room at a desk. A green chair is behind her

props.synopsis: A woman who caused a multi-car crash, which claimed the life of a twin and seriously injured three others, has been found mentally incompetent to commit the crime.

title.children: Woman found mentally incompetent at the time of fatal crash north of Adelaide

image.altText: Jason De Ieso smiles as he wears a suit with wedding flowers

props.synopsis: Seven men who were sentenced to life for the 2012 murder of an Adelaide man have been granted a retrial after having their convictions overturned on appeal.

title.children: Seven found guilty of Jason De Ieso murder have convictions overturned

image.altText: Man in a scubasuit stands in a metal cage in the ocean, two men in a small boat look over edge and chat to him

props.synopsis: In Port Lincoln, where some of the underwater shark scenes were filmed, it brought huge economic benefits, but also did untold damage to attitudes towards sharks that still linger today.

title.children: Australians behind Jaws reflect on the movie's legacy 50 years on

image.altText: Smiling woman sitting in car holding rolled and wrapped newspaper in her hand out the window

props.synopsis: Wendy Russ has delivered newspapers seven days a week, "rain, hail or shine", and kept watch over her close-knit coastal community while perfecting her tossing technique.

title.children: Community hero to retire after 20 years of tossing newspapers

image.altText: A black dog jumping up looking happy

props.synopsis: Since the beginning of the COVID pandemic telemedicine has exploded — not just for humans, but for pets too.

title.children: Pet owners turn to veterinary telemedicine for non-emergencies

image.altText: Bare branches covering a large beige building in the background

props.synopsis: A young man has been jailed for a inflicting a four-month regime of domestic violence against a woman living with a disability. Warning: This story may be distressing to some readers.

title.children: Man jailed for 'absolute horror' DV against woman living with disability

image.altText: Three children in high-vis jackets sit on a log facing away from the camera

props.synopsis: The latest Australian Early Development Census results show we are going backwards in all five key areas, sparking calls for urgent funding.

title.children: Almost half of children are not on track by the time they start school

image.altText: A person holds a can of tear gas.

props.synopsis: In the haze of gas and smoke, it can be hard to make sense of the chaos on Los Angeles streets. This is what it looks like when a progressive city in Trump's America is forced to turn on itself.

title.children: Police declared protesters 'have taken the street'. Then the scene erupted

image.altText: A man with a beard wearing sunglasses takes a selfie

props.synopsis: A man has been found guilty of murdering his housemate by setting him on fire at their home in Adelaide's west in 2021.

title.children: Man who set housemate on fire found guilty of murder

image.altText: A police officer unfurls crime scene tape.

props.synopsis: A 30-year-old woman has been charged with murder after the body of a 65-year-old man was found with multiple stab wounds at a unit in Adelaide's inner-east.

title.children: Woman charged with murder after man found at unit with stab wounds

image.altText: A queue of seven ambulances waiting outside a hospital.

props.synopsis: South Australia's ambulance union says ramping is happening at a major regional hospital, but Premier Peter Malinauskas disagrees.

title.children: Ambulances queued outside SA hospital not ramping, premier says

image.altText: A woman with a 7 News microphone in front of her face.

props.synopsis: Ms Patterson's lawyer has told the jury in her triple-murder trial she emerged "unscathed" from cross-examination, as his closing address came to an end.

title.children: Erin Patterson's lawyer urges jury to reject 'convoluted' triple-murder case

image.altText: Patrick Voss pulls Jayden Laverde's singlet.

props.synopsis: After never being given an AFL chance by Essendon, Fremantle forward Patrick Voss is out to make his old teammates hurt as the two teams face off in Perth. Follow live.

title.children: Dockers forward in fiery clash with ex-teammates after Bolton's trash talk

image.altText: a balding man in police uniform

props.synopsis: Police have charged a 46-year-old man with murder, attempted murder and aggravated assault after a police officer was fatally shot in Tasmania's north-west on Monday.

title.children: Man, 46, charged with murder after death of Tasmanian police officer

image.altText: Emory University Hospital in Atlanta, Georgia.

props.synopsis: Adriana Smith was pronounced brain dead in February but due to Georgia abortion laws, doctors say they were forced to keep her on life support for months.

title.children: Brain-dead US woman kept alive to support pregnancy dies after c-section

image.altText: Iranian flags fly as fire and smoke rise from an Israeli attack on an oil depot in Tehran

props.synopsis: Authorities in Iran have regularly restricted internet access for the country's roughly 90 million people since last week.

title.children: Iranians 'terrified' as internet blacked out amid Israeli strikes

image.altText: People looking at the departure board in Bali with flight cancellations

props.synopsis: All flights to and from Bali have resumed after being cancelled or delayed due to eruptions of Mount Lewotobi Laki-Laki.

title.children: Flights to Indonesia's Bali resume after disruption by volcano eruption

image.altText: Workers

props.synopsis: Employment decreased by about 2,000 people in May, coming off an unexpectedly strong jobs surge in April.

title.children: Employment falls by 2,500, unemployment steady as thousands leave workforce

image.altText: Four military men stand in uniform on a tank.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has hosted Pakistan's army chief at the White House, an unprecedented meeting that analysts say risks worsening a disagreement with India.

title.children: India contradicts Trump as he meets with Pakistani army chief

image.altText: close up side profile image of vladimir putin while he smiles with his mouth closed

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin says a meeting with his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy would only happen at a final phase of negotiations "so as not to sit there and divide things up endlessly, but to put an end to it".

title.children: Putin says NATO rearmament not a threat, willing to meet Zelenskyy

image.altText: A man sits in front of a store.

props.synopsis: While Israel's war with Iran continues, Gazans are begging for help, saying their suffering is being ignored because of the new conflict.

title.children: 'The massacres continue in silence': Gazans fear being forgotten amid focus on Iran

image.altText: bruce lehrmann walking outside court

props.synopsis: Former political staffer Bruce Lehrmann has pleaded not guilty to one count of motor vehicle stealing in Tasmania.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann pleads not guilty to stealing car in Tasmania

image.altText: The city of perth's skyline with the Swan River in the foreground, with two trees on either side framing the shot,

props.synopsis: Western Australia's population surges past 3 million people, with the state taking the gong for the fastest-growing jurisdiction in the country.

title.children: This state's population is growing faster than anywhere in Australia

image.altText: WA Treasurer Rita Saffioti stands speaking in parliament.

props.synopsis: Roger Cook's government has handed down its second budget — and the first since he was elected in his own right at the March state election. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: The five things you should know about the WA budget

image.altText: PALM scheme workers picking celery and placing it on a conveying belt for processing.

props.synopsis: The NSW inquiry into the risk of slavery for temporary migrant workers hears from a doctor who says many women are choosing to have abortions to stay in Australia.

title.children: Women choosing abortions to keep work visas, slavery inquiry told

image.altText: Julianne Moore puts her arm around a sad-looking Sydney Sweeney as the pair lie in bed.

props.synopsis: While the genre-crossing Echo Valley can never decide quite what it wants to be, it excels as a B-grade thriller where the greatest threat to your life is coming from inside the house.

title.children: Echo Valley, starring Sydney Sweeney, will leave you gobsmacked

image.altText: Man in suit walking

props.synopsis: An emotional witness tells the court she informed police after the men accusing MP Gareth Ward of sexual assaults confided separately to her but were too afraid to report him.

title.children: Confidante went to police to report MP’s alleged sex abuse, trial hears

image.altText: Murray Watt speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: After a meeting of stakeholders to discuss reforms to 25-year-old environmental laws, Murray Warr says many of Australia's biggest concerns, including housing, climate change, and productivity, depend on the "urgent task" being accomplished.

title.children: Housing, climate goals depend on 'urgent' update to enviro laws, says Watt

image.altText: Elinay cosmetic surgery centre 2025-06-17 10:06:00

props.synopsis: A civil tribunal hears the patient was "drifting in and out of consciousness" and had to be taken to hospital with a damaged artery.

title.children: Doctor deregistered after botched face lift at suburban clinic

image.altText: A screenshot of a video of a police officer tripping a man

props.synopsis: WA Police says it has disciplined an officer who pushed a man to the ground while on duty but will not release details of the action taken or investigation outcomes.

title.children: Police withhold how officer filmed pushing man to ground disciplined

image.altText: A satellite GIF of clouds moving over the Australian continent between March 13 and March 31

props.synopsis: The areas over the ocean where storm clouds form have dwindled by up to 3 per cent in the past two decades, new research led by NASA shows.

title.children: Earth's shrinking cloud cover may hold the key to climate mystery
